properties.value: A device is involved in excessive malicious Command and Control communication, which is already flagged by Umbrella. The Command and Control traffic may be blocked, but the persisting infection is likely still there, which requires an active response in form of for example cleaning up or re-imaging the affected devices, changing user credentials, etc.
properties.name: incident_description
properties.description: A device is involved in excessive malicious Command and Control communication, which is already flagged by Umbrella. The Command and Control traffic may be blocked, but the persisting infection is likely still there, which requires an active response in form of for example cleaning up or re-imaging the affected devices, changing user credentials, etc.
This workflow is triggered automatically in response to a Command & Control event picked up by Cisco Umbrella that creates an incident in Cisco XDR.

actions.name: Set Variables
actions.title: Set Incident ID, Description & Short Description

properties.display_name: Set Incident ID, Description & Short Description

properties.description: Send an immediate notification to the affected employee informing them of the detected ransomware activity on their device. Include instructions on immediate next steps (e.g., disconnecting the device from the network, avoiding opening unknown files and links).

input.variable_workflow_01PP78DJH1YWL3allalGQb:
### ðŸš¨ IT has detected ransomware activity on one of your devices $workflow.definition_workflow_025W2TC4F9AOH1RGNNrFqURl7VGcdKBKRZR.input.variable_workflow_0264KVO0SD3Y54Nulm0NP9REMZkqeECgAAn[0].value$ $activity.definition_activity_0263KHPGXS9MN7MLsplJtvAmjvCzMYc6cpE.output.matching_strings[0]$


#### ACTION REQUIRED:

1. Please disconnect the device from the network IMMEDIATELY.
2. Do not open unknown files or links from sources you do not trust.
3. If you do not have access to this device, please call IT Helpdesk at 1800-HELP-ME.

properties.description:
Issue a notification to the IT and security teams about the incident, supplying vital information about the impacted device, such as its IP address, hostname, user, and indicators of compromise (IOC). This helps the teams prioritize their response and swiftly implement required remediation actions.

TODO: Get a ServiceNow PDI

input.variable_workflow_024A3C33QGPO52wbhivMSR: This incident was created by Cisco XDR. Please click the following link to view the Incident in Cisco XDR: $workflow.definition_workflow_025W2TC4F9AOH1RGNNrFqURl7VGcdKBKRZR.input.variable_workflow_02608P1YZ9EML1Xjt82HXTfiEnZSvfFGoiH$

properties.description: Leveraging Cisco Umbrella, pull the categories and risk score of the domains listed in the incident. This data can be used to make a decision if the host must be automatically isolated or not. This helps protect not only the affected employee's device but also the entire organization from the identified threat.

actions.name: Condition Block
actions.title: Is Category Command And Control AND Risk > 90?

properties.display_name: Is Category Command And Control AND Risk > 90?

properties.description: Trigger a vulnerability or malware scan on the affected employee's device to identify potential weaknesses and infection points, as well as remnants of the ransomware payload.

Record the details of the ransomware attack, the affected device, and the remediation actions taken. This documentation will be beneficial in refining your organization's security strategy and improving response metrics, like mean time to detection (MTTD) and mean time to response (MTTR).

actions.name: ServiceNow - Add Work Note to Incident
actions.title: ServiceNow - Add Work Note to Incident

properties.display_name: ServiceNow - Add Work Note to Incident
